verses.verse: Whither is thy beloved <WH1730> gone <WH1980>, O thou fairest <WH3303> among women <WH802>? Whither hath thy beloved <WH1730> turned <WH6437> him <WH1245>, That we may seek him with thee?
My beloved <WH1730> is gone down <WH3381> to his garden <WH1588>, To the beds <WH6170> of spices <WH1314>, To feed <WH7462> in the gardens <WH1588>, and to gather <WH3950> lilies <WH7799>.
I am my beloved <WH1730>'s, and my beloved <WH1730> is mine <WH7462>; He feedeth his flock among the lilies <WH7799>,
Thou art fair <WH3303>, O my love <WH7474>, as Tirzah <WH8656>, Comely <WH5000> as Jerusalem <WH3389>, Terrible <WH366> as an army with banners <WH1713>.

Turn away <WH5437> thine eyes <WH5869> from me <WH1992>, For they have overcome <WH7292> me <WH8181>. Thy hair is as a flock <WH5739> of goats <WH5795>, That lie <WH1570> along the side of Gilead <WH1568>.
Thy teeth <WH8127> are like a flock <WH5739> of ewes <WH7353>, Which are come up <WH5927> from the washing <WH7367>; Whereof every one hath twins <WH8382>, And none is bereaved among them <WH7909>.
Thy temples <WH7541> are like a piece <WH6400> of a pomegranate <WH7416> Behind <WH1157> thy veil <WH6777>.
There are threescore <WH8346> queens <WH4436>, and fourscore <WH8084> concubines <WH6370>, And virgins <WH5959> without number <WH4557>.

My dove <WH3123>, my undefiled <WH8535>, is but one <WH259>; She is the only one <WH259> of her mother <WH517>; She is the choice <WH1249> one of her that bare <WH3205> her <WH1323>. The daughters saw <WH7200> her <WH833>, and called her blessed; Yea <WH4436>, the queens and the concubines <WH6370>, and they praised her <WH1984>.
Who is she that looketh forth <WH8259> as the morning <WH7837>, Fair <WH3303> as the moon <WH3842>, Clear <WH1249> as the sun <WH2535>, Terrible <WH366> as an army with banners <WH1713>?

I went down <WH3381> into the garden <WH1594> of nuts <WH93>, To see <WH7200> the green plants <WH3> of the valley <WH5158>, To see <WH7200> whether the vine <WH1612> budded <WH5132>, And the pomegranates <WH7416> were in flower <WH5132>.
Before I was aware <WH3045>, my soul <WH5315> set <WH7760> me Among the chariots <WH4818> of my princely people <WH5993>.

Return <WH7725>, return <WH7725>, O Shulammite <WH7759>; Return <WH7725>, return <WH7725>, that we may look <WH2372> upon thee <WH2372>. Why will ye look upon the Shulammite <WH7759>, As upon the dance <WH4246> of Mahanaim <WH4264>?
